body:
Following discussion on [user-Ml](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/cython-users/hO71JDjZENs)

And should fix https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/4028

Issues was that css style from generated html for annotated generated cython was leaking into the page when embeded and/or conflicting, which was annoying in IPython notebook for example. 

Fix was to force style to only apply if and only if the targeted tags are situated into a common parent tag that have a `.cython_out` css class. 

I used this excuse to slightly refactor the generation of html into sub-step.

   - one function return the css
   - one function return the javascript
   - one function return the html-annotated code
   - one return the full html

So now `save_annotation`  just have to assemble and write to file instead of intermixing logic + io.

There should be only one significant difference for small snippet of code; instead of hardcoding the yellow highlight in each `style` tag for each line, I'm generating 256 css class `.score_000` to `.score_255` that are applied to the html. This should allow much easier custom theming in future, but then for small snippet the html file grow by ~250 lines.

There is still one think that might need to be fixed is that multiple embedded snippet conflict on line number when one want to toggle the view of the generated code (should be easy, but will do in another PR).

I'm not used to work with python 2.4 to 2.6 compatibility so I hope I haven't missed anything when writing this.

Thanks.

         refnanny = re.compile(u'(__Pyx_X?(GOT|GIVE)REF|__Pyx_RefNanny[A-Za-z]+)')

commit.message: use context manager to close file, and more explicit variable name

move first part of the logic into a wrapping function

this should help to decouple from the filesystem and heuristic in
filenames
clearup unused arguments and close P tags

split _save_annotation on multiple function

will allow refactor of the cython magic not to parse temporary files
and not to leak css into IPython notebooks

add unique class name to avoid conflic

in particular tings like 'code' are conflicting when embeding the page
thou no need space for css selector

Do not use potentially not unique id to collapse

generated html can be added many time in one page relying on line number
to collapse is dangerous.

Walking the dom to  get next children is more reliable

reorganise block order, and cleanup now useless logic

special_char was use before for counting column offset, now removed.
replace by escape_html

title: Clean html-annotate generation
